About Us

First of all, thank you for installing Arrived.

This app helps you make your home in the US no matter where you are from or how you arrived. In the app, you will find info, advice, and commentary about the US immigration process. You can find housing tips, common legal questions, and even links to English language lessons.

No matter how you arrived in the US, we want to make sure you can make a smooth transition. We hope this app comes in handy—we’ve had fun making it and we hope you have fun using it!

Lastly, if you’d like to request new features, provide helpful information, or share your story, we’d love to hear from you. You can see all the ways to contact us here.
What is a visa?

A visa is a document that lets you travel to, live in, or work in a country. In the US, there are two types of visas—immigrant and non-immigrant—that serve different purposes. 

The Department of State is responsible for deciding who receives visas. You can apply for both types of visas at US embassies around the world. 
•Immigrant Visas: People wishing to immigrate to the United States. 
•Non-Immigrant visas: People wishing to visit for business or tourism, study at a school or university, or receive medical treatment in the US.
Do I need a visa?

US law requires you to have some form of documentation if you are in the country. If you do not have a visa or if you have overstayed your visa, you are considered an undocumented immigrant. Undocumented immigrants cannot vote, receive benefits, or have American passports. If you are an undocumented immigrant, however, and you do not commit a crime, authorities are unlikely to know you are here.
What are the penalties for overstaying a visa or entering the country illegally?

If you enter the US without passing through a border control post or if you provide false documents, you can face six months to two years in prison. If you are caught while crossing the border, you may go to an immigration detention center. You will then face an Immigration Court that will decide whether to deport you. If you are deported, it may hurt your chances of receiving a visa in the future.
How can I receive a green card?

You must be here with documents to receive a green card. If you are here without documents, you must secure a visa through your family, employer, military service, or university. Once you have a visa, you may begin the green card application process. It is difficult if not impossible to obtain a green card without legal status.
How can I secure a green card through my family?

If you have an American relative, you may be able to receive a visa. If you have an immediate relative in the US, you can apply for a visa and receive special priority. In particular, spouses of permanent residents, unmarried children under the age of 21, and parents of the permanent resident may “skip the line” for a visa.
How can I receive a green card through marriage?

If your spouse is an American, he or she can file for you to receive a green card and you will receive the visa immediately if you are eligible. You must marry within 90 days of entering the US and you and your fiancé are both eligible to marry each other.
How can I receive a visa through my employer?

If an employer has a high-skilled job that the US government decides it cannot fill with American workers, it may allow the employer to sponsor your visa. These high-skilled jobs must not displace an American worker, and the number of slots is capped. This visa requires a job offer so you cannot apply for a work visa without one. \"
How can I receive a visa through my school?

There are two types of visas for students: F-1 and M-1. You must be enrolled full-time in a language, vocational, or educational program approved by the USCIS. Importantly, you must be able to support yourself and intend to return home after your studies end.
How can I receive a visa for military service?

Those who honorably serve in the US Armed Services can apply for citizenship provided that they are at least 18 years old; can read, write, and speak English; and have lived in the US for five years and in the US for at least 30 months out of the past five years before the time of the application.
How can I apply for refugee status?

A refugee is someone who flees violence in his or her home country or who has reasonable fear of violence or persecution. If you are admitted to the US as a refugee or asylum seeker, you can apply for refugee status one year after arrival.
How can I become a US citizen?

The process of becoming a citizen is called naturalization.\nFive years after arrival, if you demonstrate knowledge of the English language and US history and government, you can obtain citizenship. If you marry an American, this waiting period is shortened to three years as long as you have been married for three years.\nThe advantages of citizenship over permanent residency include assisting relatives immigrate to the US and voting in elections.
How can I avoid visa scams?

1) Ask questions
2) Ask for documentation showing the person is licensed or bonded
3) Demand a written contract for immigration services
4) Get copies of the papers prepared for you
5) Get a receipt with amount paid, the date, and name and address of person or business
6) Get a second opinion
7) Make sure the immigration consultant or immigration attorney signs your forms as the preparer
Attention! You should never
1) Trust an immigration consultant or public notary just because a friend invites you to meet them
2) Pay for entire services before signing a contract or before work is complete
3) Sign blank application papers
4) Sign papers, immigration forms, or contracts that you do not fully understand
5) Let anyone keep your original documents
6) Pay for government application forms. Form are free and can be downloaded via this page.
What is the difference between an immigration consultant and lawyer?

A consultant is not the same as a lawyer. A consultant undergoes a background check and pays a fee to become licensed. He or she can answer questions on immigration forms, provide copies, submit forms, and translate questions and answers. They cannot get you visas or work permits immediately or influence government officials.\nA lawyer, on the other hand, can provide legal advice, advise which forms you will need, assist with your immigration case, and represent you in court.
How can I find housing in my area that is safe, affordable, and available?

Finding safe and comfortable housing is one of the hardest problems new immigrants face in the United States.In general, you can find housing on Craigslist (you can change the city on the site when you search).In addition, you can find a local newspaper and read the “Classifieds” section—it usually contains available apartments or home for rent.Lastly, you can go to Google and search for “rental housing + city name” on your phone to view other local websites.Many Americans also find housing by looking for signs that say “For Rent” in the neighborhood.\n\nIf you feel as if you may qualify for public housing because of your income level, you can find contact information for your local Public Housing Agency here.More information about specific state programs that provide housing assistance to those in need can be found here.
What rights do I have as a renter in general in the US?

Many laws vary by state—for a complete list of tenant rights for your state, you can visit this site. The Fair Housing Act protects people from discrimination when they are renting, buying, or securing financing for any housing. It also bans discrimination based on nationality. Landlords cannot set different prices for renters or refuse to negotiate for housing based on nationality. 

You should check if you state has standard residential leases. In these states, such as California, you should check that the lease you sign matches the standard one. 

If you feel as if you have faced discrimination in your housing search, you can and should file a complaint within one year. You can submit a HUD form here that starts an investigation into the alleged violation. If the government finds discrimination did occur, you can receive money for damages as well as the right to live in the housing. You can find more information about the Fair Housing Act and your rights under that law here.
What can I do if my landlord is taking advantage of me?

You should contact a Housing Counseling Agency in your state. A list of Housing Counseling Agencies is here.An agent provides advice on buying a home, renting, defaults, foreclosures, and credit issues. You can also call (800) 569-4287 for free.\n\nFor more information about security deposit fraud, you can visit this website for state-specific information.
What are some common job-searching websites?

Immigrants report that finding a job can be one of the hardest steps when arriving in the US. You can search for employment on websites, at local community centers, or at local businesses in your area. 

1) On Google, you can search for jobs by entering your local area (i.e., “Boston” or “Miami”) followed by a job title. 

2) Monster is one of the largest career websites in the US. It displays job opportunities for most of the largest companies as well as many small and medium businesses. You first create your profile on the website and then search by job title and location. 

3) Craigslist organizes itself by geography: you first pick your city and then you can view job placements. Many of the jobs on Craigslist are temporary, but you can also find longer-term jobs there as well. 

4) LinkedIn is a free and popular social media website for professionals. You can create a profile, enter your skills and prior jobs, and search for open opportunities. The site has search features that let you pick a location and an industry as well as type of company. You can also message companies and other users directly.
What are some other ways to find a job?

1) Talk to friends, relatives, and other recent arrivals to the US. They can put you in touch with businesses who may not advertise a job listing or who do not advertise online. Networking is a common way to find a job in the US.\n\n2) Approach local businesses in person. You can also search Google Maps for local businesses. Then you make a list of each business’ hours, address, and type. It’s best to go to these businesses when they are not busy (typically 30min after open and 30min before close). Ask to speak with the manager and bring a friend if you are not at ease speaking English yet. Be sure to bring a copy of your resume if you have one (and see the section in this app about resume writing!). An in-person visit helps more than a resume drop off or online application.
How do I write a resume?
Sample resume 1\n\nSample resume 2
I was discriminated at work. Is discrimination against the law?

Discrimination at work based on age, skin color, nationality, and religion is undocumented. Your employer also has an obligation to stop any harassment from co-workers due to your race, nationality, or religion. Your employer also cannot treat you differently because of your accent. You cannot be hired or fired because of your religion, skin color, or nationality, and employers may not retaliate against you if you file a discrimination claim. If you feel as if you have been discriminated, write down the facts of the case and contact the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC).
Where can I find legal help?

Many local, state, and national organizations can help you tackle immigration problems. You can begin with a search on Google for immigrant legal center followed by your city name. Some of these organizations will provide support but not legal counsel; others will provide free legal services or put you in touch with law clinics. You can also search for “voluntary,” “civil rights lawyer,” or “immigration law clinic OR caucus” to find an organization that can help you. Local law schools at universities may also have students who can provide legal assistance.
How do I know I can trust an organization?

You should ask each organization for a list of partner organizations. Most non-profits have connections with other local or national non-profits. In addition, you should ask if they could put you in touch with past clients.
I have an immigration appeal. Which organization can provide services for me?

You should find an organization recognized by the Board of Immigration Appeals (BIA). For an organization to be recognized, it must have enough knowledge and experience to provide services to immigrants. A recognized organization can charge or accept only very small fees for those services. For a list of these BIA-recognized organizations, visit www.justice.gov/eoir/recognition-accreditationroster-reports. 

• An Accredited Representative: People who are connected to BIA recognized organizations. These representatives can charge or accept only very small fees for their services. For a list of these BIA-accredited representatives, visit http://www.justice.gov/eoir/recognition-accreditationroster-reports. 

• A Qualified Representative: People who will provide free services. These representatives must know about immigration law and the rules of practice in court. Law school students and graduates, and people with good moral character who have a personal or professional affiliation with you (relative, neighbor, clergy, co-worker, or friend) are all examples of qualified representatives. 

• Free Legal Service Providers: The Department of Justice has a list of recognized free legal service providers for people who are in immigration proceedings. This is a list of attorneys and organizations that may be willing to represent immigrants in proceedings before immigration courts. The attorneys and organizations on this list have agreed to help immigrants pro bono (free of charge) only in immigration proceedings. Some of them may not be able to help you with non-court-related matters, such as visa petitions, naturalization, etc. The list is available at www.justice.gov/eoir/free-legal-services-providers. 

• Pro Bono Program: Local lists of recognized pro bono organizations and their representatives are usually available at each local USCIS office. For more information about finding legal services, please visit USCIS.
What should I do when I encounter the police, immigration, or customs agents?

• You have to give your name and date of birth—nothing else 

\• You do not need to answer any other questions 

• You have the right to talk to a lawyer first and receive interpretation services 

• Agents may not enter your home without a warrant 

• While agents can pat you down, they cannot perform a wider search 

• You should neither sign any documents without a lawyer present nor present any false documents 

• Record the agent’s name and ID


Here is a sample conversation with phrases you should use: 

\1. “I choose to remain silent.” 

2. “I need {Spanish/Portuguese/Chinese…} language help.” 

3. “Am I free to leave?” 

a. If no: “I would like to speak to a lawyer” 

b. If yes: Leave immediately 

4. “I want to contact this (organization/attorney) at this (phone number).”
What to do if Immigrations and Customs Enforcement arrests you?

• Ask for a lawyer and stay quiet. Only state your name and date of birth. 

• Always give your complete and true name. 

• Call family and ask them to find you a lawyer. 

• Do not sign any papers without consulting a lawyer. 

• You will be assigned an “A Number.” Write it down and share it with your family. 

• Ask for a bond. 

• Write down who is arresting you and their ID numbers. 

• Asked to be released on bond. If it is denied, ask for a bond hearing before a judge. 

• If you are given an electronic ankle bracelet for tracking, you can file a challenge with the immigration court within seven days of your release.
What do I need to know about posting bond?

Posting bond means you go to a prison or jail and pay money to release an inmate. This money is returned to you if the inmate arrives at his or her court appearance (typically 1-3 months after the initial detention). In some cases, you cannot post bond. \n\nMost people are eligible for bond unless they have a history of serious criminal convictions. If you have illegally re-entered after deportation may not get bond either. However, if you have been in custody for over six months, you may request bond no matter your criminal or deportation past. Once bond is posted, you will be released and required to appear before a judge in deportation or removal hearings at a later date.
How can I post bond?

You can call the DHS Detention and Deportation branch and give the person’s name, date of birth, date of arrest, and number. You can then ask if the bond has been set and the steps to pay it. To post bond, you must be a citizen or legal resident of the United States. By posting bond, you accept responsibility for that person presenting him- or herself before a deportation official. They may run a background check on the payer, so you may wish to consult an attorney beforehand. When the case is complete, you will receive the money back assuming the person has complied with the ruling and does not attempt to flee.
What is a deportation proceeding?

Removal Proceedings are a series of hearings in immigration court overseen by an immigration judge. An attorney at the hearing will represent both the Department of Homeland Security and Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Unlike a criminal proceeding, the government will not provide a lawyer for you. The consequences for not appearing at a court hearing are severe. There are two types of hearings: master and individual. Master hearings are shorter whereas individual hearings are longer and let you plead your case. A decision is not typically made at your first hearing.
What is cancellation of removal?

Cancellation of Removal is a ruling for those without status to prevent their deportation. In order to be eligible for cancellation of removal, you must be a person of good character, a resident in the US for 10 years before the removal proceedings began, and a law-abiding individual free of criminal charges. In addition, if your removal would case grave harm to a US resident or citizen, you may be able to receive a cancellation of removal.
What is temporary protected status?

Temporary Protected Status (TPS) is a status for foreign nationals in the US whose home countries are unsafe. You cannot renew TPS if you have been convicted of a crime. You cannot leave the US with TPS without prior permission.
What is adjustment of status?

Adjustment of Status (AOS) is a procedure that allows for an individual to apply for lawful permanent resident status without leaving the US. Either your family or your employer can file the petition to grant you AOS. However, if you are in the US without documents, you may not be able to adjust status even with a petition.
What are my constitutional rights?

If immigration agents or local police arrested you illegally, you may be able to challenge the evidence against you in immigration court. Immigrants still have constitutional rights, and agents must respect those rights.
What are some ways to learn English online?

These websites will help you learn English online: 

• The Carlos Slim Foundation created an Android/iOS app called apprende.org that teaches you everyday English for your job. You can study vocabulary and terms in different areas including arts and culture, health, and work-related fields. It’s free to download and use, and many immigrants have rated it highly. 

• USA Learns. The US government created a website that teaches English for free online. It is aimed for beginners and intermediate learners. 

• BBC. The British television broadcaster created free English lessons you can use online. These materials will teach you pronunciation and everyday English. It is best for those with some knowledge of English already. 

• Pronunciation. Many who study English find that pronouncing words is one of the hardest parts of learning the language. This website provides “listen and repeat” exercises for common sounds. 

• TV. Television is an excellent way to learn English. You can start by watching TV in English with English sub-titles. At first, many of the words will be confusing. But if you keep a dictionary near you and look up words as you see them, you will find that you can slowly build a strong vocabulary. 

• Blogs. You can also read blogs to learn English. ESL Hip Hop takes its inspiration from influential hip hop/rap songs to teach everything from prepositions to tenses. 

• Apps. The Play Store has many apps that teach English. The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) launched a conversational English app with quick six-minute lessons. LearnEnglish Podcasts is a perfect app for slightly more advanced students—its episodes feature native speakers discussing their hobbies, weekend plans, and activities and a highlighted script you can read while listening. Lastly, DuoLingo is a popular app among Americans learning a foreign language; its English-language version builds vocabulary and grammar via fun, fast games and daily challenges. 

• Dictionaries. WordReference and BabelFish are two online dictionaries for English-Spanish and Spanish-English translation.
How can I learn common phrases in English along with their meanings?

Idioms are short phrases that you will encounter when speaking or reading English. These expressions are incredibly helpful to convey an idea, but they often are nonsensical when read at first. This website provides an explanation of common idioms in English. If you feel confident in your English already, you can study these idioms and begin to use them in conversation. Once you start to learn them, you will start to hear these expressions frequently!
What support groups are open to me as a documented/undocumented immigrant?

The US has many local, state, and national groups that cater to immigrants from all backgrounds. PublicEye.org keeps a thorough list here. You can also find more groups here thanks to the National Network for Immigrant and Refugee Rights.
How can I share this app with my friends?
You can share this app by clicking on the icon on the top right corner of the page.
Help! I need a lawyer. Could you please refer me?

Unfortunately, we cannot provide legal advice or refer you to an attorney. However, you can find a lawyer in your area who can assist with your specific case with Google, through referrals from friends or relatives, or at a local library’s law section. In addition, the Department of Justice has a list of free legal service providers by state. It also has a database of accredited or trustworthy organizations that provide legal services to immigrants.

What is the Dream Act and how can I benefit?

The DREAM Act (acronym for Development, Relief, and Education for Alien Minors) is an American legislative proposal for a multi-phase process for undocumented immigrants in the United States that would first grant conditional residency and upon meeting further qualifications, permanent residency.
If I am an undocumented immigrant, can I enroll my children in public school?

All children in the United States are entitled to equal access to a basic public elementary and secondary education regardless of their actual or perceived race, color, national origin, citizenship, immigration status, or the status of their parents/guardians. School districts that either prohibit or discourage, or maintain policies that have the effect of prohibiting or discouraging, children from enrolling in schools because they or their parents/guardians are not U.S. citizens or are undocumented may be in violation of Federal law.
What is Khan Academy?

Khan Academy is a personalized learning resource for all ages. Khan Academy offers practice exercises, instructional videos, and a personalized learning dashboard that empower learners to study at their own pace in and outside of the classroom. It teaches math, science, computer programming, history, art history, economics, and more.

A consulate is an office of one nation located in the country of another. For example, at the Mexican consulate in San Francisco, diplomats work to represent Mexicans living in the US with paperwork, advice, and even legal visitation if they are arrested. The grounds of a consulate do not belong to the host country. So the Mexican consulate in San Francisco is part of Mexico—not the United States. A Consul General is the head of the office. Consulates can be found in major cities of a country, but typically not the capital of a country. \n\n An embassy, on the other hand, is located in the capital of a country. An ambassador oversees the office. It performs many of the same duties as the consulate but on a larger scale.

I am a victim of labor trafficking. What can I do now that I have arrived in the US?

Labor trafficking is a form of slavery that occurs when someone is taken from his or her home, smuggled to a new place, and forced to work. But labor trafficking can take other forms as well: debt bondage, coercion, and even child labor. Certain industries such as agriculture, hospitality, and manufacturing employ more trafficked individuals than others.

If you have been forced, defrauded, or coerced into working, you can call the National Human Trafficking Resource Center (1-888-373-7888) 24 hours a day, seven days a week, for free to speak to someone who can help you.

In 2000, the US government enacted a new law to protect victims of trafficking. Benefits include educational, health care, job training, and other state or federal programs that refugees receive in the US. In addition, victims may be eligible for the witness protection program.

In addition, the law created the T Visa that allows victims of severe forms of trafficking and their immediate family members to become temporary residents of the US.
What are my rights as an undocumented worker in the United States?

Undocumented workers enjoy all of the legal rights provided by both federal and state law.

So the same Federal and California wage and hour laws that apply to authorized workers generally apply to persons working without legal immigration status. These laws establish your right to minimum wage, overtime pay, breaks, tips, and other forms of wages. For example, an employer cannot refuse to pay you by saying that you should not have been working in the first place because you have no “papers.”

If you choose to file a wage claim, you can either file with the California Division of Labor Standards Enforcement (the “Labor Commissioner”) or sue your employer in court. You can also contact the U.S. Department of Labor (DOL). Neither of these agencies should question you about your immigration status.

However, if you do report your employer, he may retaliate against you by contacting immigration authorities who may deport you.
How can I receive a driver’s license?

If you are an immigrant in the US who has documentation, you can apply for a driver’s licenses at your state’s Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV). You will typically need to bring proof of your identity and an original copy of your driving permit from your home country. If you are an undocumented immigrant, certain states will let you take a driver’s test and receive a license. California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Maryland, New Mexico, Nevada, Utah, Vermont and Washington D.C., and Washington allow it. To apply for a license in these states, follow the advice at the bottom of this page.
What do I do if a police officer stops my car?

1. Slow down safely and park beside the road without blocking traffic.

2. Lower the driver’s side window.

3. Keep your hands on the steering wheel.

4. Do not reach in your pocket or to the glove compartment—the officer will assume you are reaching for a gun.

5. Say as little as possible and politely end sentences with “officer” or “sir.”

6. If an officer tries to search your body or car, you can say, “Officer, I’m not resisting. I do not consent to this search.” 

7. Never touch or physically resist a police officer.
How can I be a safe driver?

You should always obey the speed limit and street signs, especially in school zones and cities. Remember that in the US, turn signals and street lines are rules not suggestions, and drivers are often distracted with cell phones and meals while behind the wheel. In the US, most intersections have crosswalks and although you may be tempted to pull up to the white line, you may hit or block pedestrians crossing the street.
Health Knowledge
How can I purchase health insurance?

With the Affordable Care Act (ACA), you are required to sign up for healthcare insurance if you live in the US as a citizen or documented immigrant. If you do not purchase insurance, you will have to pay a fine. 

If you are an undocumented immigrant or incarcerated, you are not eligible to sign up for the healthcare exchanges. You will not be charged a penalty for failing to purchase health insurance. In addition, undocumented immigrants are not eligible for federal coverage including Medicare and non-emergency Medicaid. 

Health care plans vary by state, so you can’t compare plans across state lines. Some states provide limited free medical service regardless of immigration status (such as Medi-Cal in California), so you should check if your state has a similar program. The cheapest health care option for immigrant families who do not purchase health insurance is a community health center. A directory of community health centers is here. At these health centers, you pay what you can afford.
If I am sick and go to a hospital and can’t afford it, what happens next?

You have a few options: make sure the charges on the bill are correct; ask if the hospital will draft an interest-free payment plan; ask for an on-time pay discount; and apply for financial assistance. If you still cannot afford the bills, you can file for Chapter 7 bankruptcy (if your income is below the median income for your state) or Chapter 13 (and allow the hospital to deduct your wages until the bill is repaid).
How can I purchase healthy food at a low price?

In the US, many restaurants and supermarkets offer unhealthy yet cheap food. You can go to membership supermarkets such as Costco and Sam’s Club to purchase food in bulk at discounted prices. In addition, you should see if your town has a farmer’s market where you can purchase fruits and vegetables at lower prices than a local supermarket.

How can I open a bank account?

Many banks in the US let you open a bank account for free. There are two types of accounts: checking and savings. A checking account gives the account holder a book of checks that some businesses accept instead of cash. These accounts do not earn interest. A savings account, on the other hand, will give you a debit card and allow you to earn a small interest rate. The main banks in the US are Bank of America, Chase, Wells Fargo, TD Bank, and Citi Bank.
How can I sign up for a credit card?

You need a credit score to sign up for a credit card. A credit score is a rating that predicts how likely you are to repay your debts. A high credit score is 850 and 200 is a low credit score. You can start a credit score by applying for a secured credit card. If you make payments each month and do not spend over the limit, your credit score will increase over time.
I need to file for taxes. How can I pay them?

Each April, Americans pay taxes to the federal, state, and local governments. Both TurboTax and VITA can help you file for taxes for free. Many individuals qualify for free tax preparation from TurboTax. 

TurboTax is a software program that calculates how much you owe in federal and state taxes if applicable. Typically, Americans pay taxes every April. If you earn less than $100,000 and you have standard deductions, you can file for free with the TurboTax Federal Free Edition. 

VITA is a government service to individuals earning less than $54,000 per year or taxpayers with limited English. IRS-certified volunteers will prepare your tax return at a community center near you. You can find VITA locations here. 

\If you are self-employed or you work at home, you may be able to deduct car, rent, equipment, and other costs from your tax bill. You should check which deductions apply to you.
What is a loan shark and how do I avoid them?

A loan shark offers short-term loans at high interest rates. In the US, these lenders are also known as payday lending companies. Many states have set maximum interest rates that you can offer for a loan (typically below 50%). Several states have rules that limit the number of rollovers allowed. So if you live in Texas, the payday lender cannot rollover the debt into the next period (and increase the total amount owed).
How can I track my income and expenses with an app or online?

What is a public defender?

In the US, every individual has a right to a lawyer if convicted of a crime. If you are convicted of a crime but cannot afford an attorney, the court will appoint a public defender (a government official) to represent you in court. These public defenders will take your side in a case and attempt to dismiss or reduces the charges.
What is InterNations?

InterNations is a social networking site for foreigners and ex-pats. The website is free to use and lets you create a profile similar to Facebook and connect with others. You can participate in events, groups, and forums to meet other travelers or immigrants from around the world in person or online.

What are the criteria for an EB-1A visa and how many of them do I need to satisfy?

You need to meet at least three of the ten criteria (the full list is here). However, even if you meet the three criteria requirement you still need to demonstrate “extraordinary ability” but in practice all applicants with three criteria met will be approved. The entire process can take between three and eight months.
I work for a foreign company owned by a US company. How can I immigrate to the US?

You may be able to apply for an L-1 transferee visa that allows a US employer to transfer an executive or manager from a foreign affiliate office to its US office. It also allows companies without a US office to send a manager to the US to open one as long as the employee is doing or will do business in the US. The duration of the visa is one to three years. Although it’s easier for employees of large multinational “blanket” companies, you can still receive one if you work at a small company if you meet the criteria. However, you may need to back up your application with more substantial documentation in this case.
I do not have a university degree. Can I still receive a work visa?

Yes, a formal university education is not a prerequisite for a visa to work in the US. If you have significant and exceptional work experience you can apply for an H-1B or even O-1 visa to work in the US.
How much should I invest to receive an E-2 visa? How much of it should be spent in the US before I apply?

In general, you want to spend over $100,000 to qualify for this visa. This money should be raised from you or other investors in your country. The lower the dollar amount you invest, though, the more of it you need to prove you have spent in the US before you submit your E-2 application. So for a $100,000 investment, you should prove you have spent nearly all of it.
What is a U visa and do I qualify?

A U Visa is a non-immigrant visa that grants status to victims of crimes such as human trafficking, domestic violence, sexual assault, mental abuse, or other crimes. Individuals who have been harmed can apply for themselves and their families to receive this visa, and the U Visa requires recipients to cooperate with the police investigating the crimes committed. What is credible fear and does it apply to me?

In the US, a person cannot be subject to deportation if he or she has a “credible fear” of persecution due to race, religion, etc., or torture after returning home. If you are detained by border officials and processed for expedited deportation, you can request a credible fear interview with an Asylum Official. You will then present your case before an Immigration Judge who can grant a deferral of removal. Afterward, you may apply for asylum from the detention facility or after you are released on bond. You should be honest and detailed in your initial interview, because if you add details in later hearings with other officials it may be held against you. The government will provide a lawyer at no cost upon request.

What is AccesoLatino and how can it help me?

The TN visa is a non-immigrant NAFTA Professional visa. NAFTA is a free trade agreement among the US, Canada, and Mexico. It grants a certain number of visas for professionals working in these professions from Mexico to work in the US. To receive this visa, you must complete Form DS-160 and schedule an interview. The fee is $160 per application.

AccesoLatino is a website created by the Carlos Slim Foundation to assist Mexicans coming to the US. It provides career, English, driver’s license, and naturalization help. You can watch videos, browse job training sites, find resources for learning English, and find Latin American consulates in the US.
How can I send money back to my home country?

You have many options for sending money to your home country, and each provider offers advantages over the others. In general, cash-to-cash transfers cost far more than bank-to-bank transfers. Sending money online, however, may take longer to arrive. There are many hidden costs when transferring money overseas so it’s important to compare the companies that offer these services. 

•TransferWise is the cheapest option for sending money to Mexico is well-regarded for its quality of service.The cost per transfer varies based on the dollar amount, but it uses a fair, public exchange rate for everytransaction. 

•WesternUnion is one of the cheapest options because of its competitive exchange rates. For cash pickup, there are over 26,000 WesternUnion locations across Mexico. In addition, there is no fee if you send up to $2750 online or via the WesternUnion app to a bank account in Mexico. In-person transfers with cash pickup arrive within minutes. 

•Remitly has both low costs and many locations in Mexico. The exchange rates are competitive, and transfers are free if you pay with a bank account. A debit card transfer, meanwhile, costs $4. 

•Ria has the largest network of pickup locations in Mexico. It costs $3 to cover a transfer from a bank account or $4 with a debit card regardless of the amount. Transfers from debit or credit cards arrive within minutes while transfers from bank accounts can take up to five days.
What is voluntary departure and why should I care?

Voluntary departure provides some benefits over deportation if you are detained. If you choose to return to your home country voluntary, the Department of Homeland Security will not put a removal order on you. In this case, you avoid deportation. You can request to leave voluntarily while in removal proceedings before the hearing, while in Immigration Court, and even after the proceedings if you are about to be deported. Your immigration record stays clean since you will not receive a deportation order, so you will not automatically be prevented from returning the US legally in the future. In addition, you are required to leave the country within 60 or 120 days, so you will have time to take care of your affairs.

What is a FICO score?

A FICO score is a credit score developed by Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO). It is widely recognized as an industry standard used by financial institutions to evaluate the creditworthiness of a potential borrower. FICO maintains an algorithm that pulls credit data collected by the three national credit bureaus (Equifax, Experian and TransUnion) and produces a single, three-digit score from each of the three credit bureaus. Most FICO scores range from 300 to 850. The higher the score the lower the credit risk.
How does compound interest work?

Compound interest is an interest that is applied to both the initial principal and the accumulated interests on the loan. Essentially, the interest earned each period is added to the principal, which allows you to earn a higher interest for the next period. Because the interest is “compounded”, the total balance not only grows, but grows exponentially.
What is a credit score and how can I build a strong rating for myself?

A credit score is a number that is based on an analysis of a person’s credit history, and is used by lenders to predict the default risk of a potential borrower. In the United States, a credit score is primarily based on credit reports produced by the three major credit bureaus: Equifax, Experian and TransUnion. There are different algorithms to calculate credit scores, FICO score developed by Fair Isaac Corporation is one of the most popular scores used by lenders. 

In order to build a strong credit rating, it is important to understand what types of data are used to calculate the score. A FIFO score is based on the following five categories of information, each with a weight assigned to reflect the importance of the factor. 

• Payment history (35\%%) 

• Amounts owed (30\%%) 

• Length of credit history (15\%%) 

• Credit mix (10\%%) 

• New credit (10\%%) 

There are a number of ways to build a strong credit rating, however, most take time. Hence it is important to manage it overtime. 

• Apply for a credit card. This is the easiest and quickest way to establish a credit profile. 

• Pay your bills on time and every time. This is the most important of part of building and maintaining a good credit score. 

• Keep the balance low. The credit score takes into account of how likely you would reach your credit card limit. Hence it is better to keep the balance low relative to the total credit limit. It is often advised to keep the balance under 30% of the limit. If you happen to go beyond 30%, a trick is to pay it down before the balance is reported to the credit bureau, usually on the statement closing date. 

• Having a long credit history. The longer (and better) credit history you have, the more data/evidence there is for the credit bureau to establish your good credit rating. 

• Having a variety of credit products. Other things equal, a portfolio of different credit products, such as a mortgage, an auto loan and a credit card will produce a higher score than having just a credit card. 

• Do not apply for a lot of credit over a short period of time. This contributes to the “new credit” component. Opening several credit accounts over a short period of time represents a greater risk. Because it may appear that you are experiencing liquidity issues.
